name: AFCAT (Air Force Common Admission Test)
description: A national-level competitive examination conducted by the Indian Air Force (IAF) twice a year for the selection of officers in Flying, Ground Duty (Technical), and Ground Duty (Non-Technical) branches.

eligibility.ageLimit: Flying Branch: 20 to 24 years. Ground Duty (Technical & Non-Technical): 20 to 26 years. Age limits are calculated as of a specific date mentioned in the notification. Marital Status: Candidates below 25 years of age must be unmarried at the time of commencement of course.
eligibility.educationalQualification: Varies by branch. Flying Branch: Graduates with 60% in any discipline with Physics & Maths at 10+2 level OR BE/B.Tech with 60%. Ground Duty (Technical): Specific B.E./B.Tech degrees with 60% marks. Ground Duty (Non-Technical): Graduate Degree (minimum 3 years) in any discipline with 60% marks.
eligibility.nationality: Must be a citizen of India.

timeline.notificationDate: AFCAT 1: December; AFCAT 2: June. For AFCAT 2 2024, the notification was released on May 20, 2024.
timeline.examDate: Conducted biannually in February and August. The exam for AFCAT 2 2024 is scheduled for August 9, 10, and 11, 2024.
timeline.resultDate: Usually declared within 3-4 weeks after the exam.

stages.name: Stage 1: Online Written Examination
stages.description: An online test consisting of the AFCAT paper for all candidates. Candidates opting for Ground Duty (Technical) branch have to appear for an additional Engineering Knowledge Test (EKT). Total Duration: AFCAT (2 hours), EKT (45 minutes).

stages.name: Stage 2: Air Force Selection Board (AFSB) Testing
stages.description: Shortlisted candidates are called for AFSB testing at various centers. This 5-day process includes a Screening Test (Day 1) and further Psychological tests, Group Tests, and an Interview for successful candidates.

stages.name: Stage 3: Medical Examination
stages.description: Candidates recommended by the AFSB will undergo a medical examination at the Air Force Central Medical Establishment (AFCME), New Delhi or Institute of Aviation Medicine, Bengaluru.

examPattern.markingScheme: For AFCAT: +3 marks for every correct answer, -1 mark for every incorrect answer. No marks for unattempted questions.

latestUpdate.title: AFCAT 2 2024 Application form is available from 30 May to 28 June 2024.
